moves.4. d4 exd4: Morphy always loved to open lines.
moves.7... Bd7 8. Nxc6 bxc6 9. Bd3 Bc5: Morphy already has a lead in development. Any of us would be thinking here about castling to get the King out of the line of fire.
moves.10. Bxe4 Qh4 11. Qe2 dxe4: Black's attack is formidable. White *must* castle here or his King will be an orphan in the storm.
moves.12. Be3: Misses his last chance to avoid the onrushing tsunami.
moves.12... Bg4 13. Qc4 Bxe3: Morphy always was a master at executing the attack, especially when the defenses have weak points.
moves.14. g3 Qd8 15. fxe3: Equalizes the material, at the terrible cost of allowing a mating attack.
moves.16. Kf2 Qf3+ 17. Kg1 Bh3: Mate is inevitable. White plays a couple of spite checks to salvage some pride.
moves.18. Qxc6+ Kf8 19. Qxa8+ Ke7: White is out of checks. He resigns, as it is mate next move. Or if he sacrifices his Queen, mate in 2 moves.
